column1: This area above the <CASE> flag is for notes, etc.
Under key word definition, undefined keywords may be any number of spaces, or a null string
Note that demand has no decisions.
Note that unmet demand is represented a source with a variable cost only, so unmet demand has an output decision.

column2: Name of technology, must be unique
Name of node from which this technology would get or give its energy (or in the case of transmission, the receiving node)
Name of auxially node, e.g., node from transmission will get its energy
Pointer to time series file that will ultimately get loaded under the keyword <series>
Possible non-negative number. If 'normalization' is defined, then the series associated with that tech (defined by series_file) is transformed to have a mean equal to the number supplied
Option to specify the capacity of a technology. If this number is supplied, then the technology capacity is fixed and is not included as a decision variable in the optimization
Fixed cost; must be defined if n_capacity > 0
Variable cost; must be defined if n_dispatch_in > 0 or n_dispatchout > 0
Possible contraint for case when n_capacity = 1, n_dispatch_in =1 and n_dispatch_out = 1 (e.g., battery)
Possible factor for case when n_capacity = 1, n_dispatch_in =1 and n_dispatch_out = 1 (e.g., battery), applied on way in to reservoir; also known as round trip efficiency
Possible decay rate for storage in units of fraction per time step
